PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Anбlise e otimizaзгo estrutural de torres eуlicas de concreto armado e protendido
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O estudo de soluзхes econфmicas para estruturas de aerogeradores eуlicos tem despertado o interesse devido ao apelo ambiental desta fonte de energia renovбvel. Particularmente, as torres eуlicas de aзo tкm sido bastante estudas tanto no que concerne а anбlise quanto а otimizaзгo estrutural. Em geral miniza-se o consumo de material que estб diretamente relacionado ao custo. Entretanto, limitaзхes nas dimensхes devidas ao transporte tкm sido um fator importante para o emprego de torres de concreto armado e protendido alйm de vantagens relativas ao comportamento а fadiga, custos e manutenзгo. Pretende-se, neste trabalho, estudar os modelos de anбlise de torres eуlicas de concreto armado e protendido assim como propor um modelo para otimizaзгo destas estruturas. O modelo de otimizaзгo poderб incluir variбveis contнnuas assim como discretas, optando-se pela soluзгo via algoritmos evolutivos (AG e PSO). PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Chalenges with Respect to Aerogenerators` Foundation in Coastal Zones
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Project Introduction: With the perspective of climatic and demographical issues, the development of cleaner and renewable energies is necessary to address environmental challenges. Public works should stimulate innovation in the construction of wind power plant sites and energy transport infrastructure, in collaboration with research centres and universities. This includes the structures needed for the production of wind power: the wind turbines (also called aerogenerators) and its foundations. The project is, then, inserted in item a of the Call for Projects 01/2019 by FUNCAP/INSA-Rouen. This project is interested in the structural behaviour of aerogenerators? foundations in coastal zones (also called ?Land-Sea Continuum?). It includes the behaviour of the concrete foundation structure itself and the soils behaviour, as well as their interaction. The project regroups principal teams in laboratories from the state of Cearб in Brazil and from the region of Normandy in France, with orbital teams also in Cearб and in the region Auvergne-Rhфne-Alpes in France. At the French side, the team from Institut National des Sciences Appliquйes de Rouen (INSA-Rouen) leads the project with orbital teams from Universitй Le Havre Normandie, Ecole Supйrieure des Ingйnieurs des Travaux et de la Construction de Caen (ESITC-Caen), Centre d'Etudes et d'Expertise sur les Risques, l'Environnement, la Mobilitй et l'Amйnagement (CEREMA Normandie Centre) and Laboratory of Tribology and Dynamics of Systems (LTDS) at University of Lyon/ENTPE and at Ecole Nationale d?Ingйnieurs de Saint Etienne (ENISE). At the Brazilian side, a team from the National Science and Technology Institute for the Characterization of Materials for Infrastructure (INCT-Infra) leads the group that is also composed by a team from the Laboratory of Building Materials (LMCC) and the Laboratory of Computer Systems Engineering (LESC), all three from the Federal University of Cearб at Fortaleza (UFC), and also the Group of Atmospheric Research from the State University of Cearб (UECE). The groups in France have been working with focus in the behaviour of soils foundations, particularly with respect to wind turbine foundations, while the groups in Fortaleza can be divided into two parts: INCT-Infra and LMCC are focused in the characterisation of materials and structures, mainly for building engineering and infrastructure, while the remaining groups have expertise on sensors network and can also contribute with climate input (which affects the behaviour of structures). This project brings these groups together to address a problem that is of particular importance to the region of Normandy and to the state of Cearб due to their own geography and potential for wind power generation. The focus is on the structural behaviour of the foundation, from the construction to the service life of the aerogenerator. - Objectives: This project deals with the behaviour of wind turbine foundations in the Land-Sea Continuum and its associated pathologies. The specific objectives may be summarised and detailed in the 5 following points. 1- To evaluate the response of wind turbine foundations in coastal zone, to identify associated pathologies, and in particular, to estimate the risk with respect to liquefaction phenomena during water level fluctuations. 2- To take into account the spatial variability of the soil properties of foundations in the soil/structure interaction. 3- To evaluate the properties of the concrete material of the foundations: fatigue, cracking, durability. 4- To numerically model the soil-structure interactions under cyclic solicitation and to optimize the design of wind turbine foundations by instrumenting a real wind turbine site. 5- To evaluate the use of instrumentations in wind turbine foundations for comparison of real experimental responses with models already developed.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Este projeto tratarб do desenvolvimento de uma metodologia para modelagem computacional da queda de risers, incluindo o estudo da influкncia da malha de elementos finitos, do algoritmo de integraзгo, do incremento de tempo, do tipo de riser, do local do rompimento, da lвmina d'бgua, do fluido interno, das condiзхes ambientais e do modelo de solo sobre a trajetуria de queda. O projeto tambйm estudarб a possibilidade de contato/impacto do riser com ele mesmo, com outros risers, linhas de ancoragem e equipamentos submarinos, incluindo a avaliaзгo da energia de contato.
